snippet: Families facing a diagnosis of the disease can only ask: Should they live their lives differently, get their affairs in order, join a clinical trial of an experimental drug?
abstract: New brain scan technology that detects early stages of Alzheimer's forces families who receive diagnosis of essentially untreatable disease to wonder if they should live their lives differently, get their affairs in order or join clinical trial of an experimental drug; issue highlights problem of new era of Alzheimer's research, in which ability to detect disease has leapt far ahead of treatments.
lead_paragraph: Families facing a diagnosis of the disease can only ask: Should they live their lives differently, get their affairs in order, join a clinical trial of an experimental drug?

headline.main: For Alzheimer’s, Detection Advances Outpace Treatment Options
